fields.name: Agile
fields.description: multiple attack penalty on the 2nd attack each turn with this weapon is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the 3rd and subsequent attacks in the turn.

fields.name: Attached
fields.description: must be combined with another piece of gear to be used.

fields.name: Backstabber
fields.description: When you hit a flat-footed creature, this weapon deals 1 precision damage

fields.name: Backswing
fields.description: You can use this weapon’s momentum from a miss to lead into your next attack

fields.name: Charge
fields.description: If you moved on the action before your attack, add a circumstance bonus to damage

fields.name: Deadly
fields.description: On a critical hit, the weapon adds a weapon damage die of the listed size.

fields.name: Disarm
fields.description: You can use this weapon to Disarm with the Athletics skill even if you don’t have a free hand.

fields.name: Dwarf
fields.description: People of the dwarf ancestry craft and use these weapons.

fields.name: Elf
fields.description: People of the elf ancestry craft and use these weapons.

fields.name: Fatal
fields.description: On a critical hit, all theweapon’s damage dice increase to that die size instead of the normal dice, plus the weapon adds another die of damage of the listed size

fields.name: Finesse
fields.description: You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier when making attack rolls with this melee weapon.

fields.name: Forceful
fields.description: When you attack with it more than once on your turn, the second attack adds a circumstance bonus to damage equal to the number of weapon damage dice, and each subsequent attack adds a circumstance bonus to damage equal to double the number of weapon damage dice

fields.name: Free-Hand
fields.description: This weapon doesn’t take up your hand, usually because it is built into your armor. A free-hand weapon can’t be Disarmed.

fields.name: Gnome
fields.description: People of the gnome ancestry craft and use these weapons.

fields.name: Goblin
fields.description: People of the goblin ancestry craft and use these weapons.

fields.name: Halfling
fields.description: People of the halfling ancestry craft and use these weapons.

fields.name: Monk
fields.description: Monks can use these weapons with their abilities that normally require unarmed attacks.

fields.name: Nonlethal
fields.description: All attacks with this weapon are nonlethal.

fields.name: Orc
fields.description: People of the orc ancestry craft and use these weapons.

fields.name: Parry
fields.description: This weapon can be used defensively to block attacks.

fields.name: Propulsive
fields.description: You add half your Strength modifier to damage rolls with a propulsive ranged weapon so long as your Strength modifier is not negative. If you have a negative Strength modifier, you add your full Strength modifier instead

fields.name: Reach
fields.description: h This weapon is long and can be used to attack creatures up to 10 feet away instead of only adjacent creatures.

fields.name: Shove
fields.description: You can use this weapon to Shove with the Athletics skill even if you don’t have a free hand.

fields.name: Sweep
fields.description: This weapon makes wide sweeping or spinning attacks, making it easier to attack multiple enemies.

fields.name: Thrown
fields.description: You can throw this weapon as a ranged attack.

fields.name: Trip
fields.description: You can use this weapon to Trip with the Athletics skill even if you don’t have a free hand.

fields.name: Twin
fields.description: These weapons are used as a pair, each complementing the other.

fields.name: Two-Hand
fields.description: This weapon can be wielded with two hands.

fields.name: Unarmed
fields.description: An unarmed attack uses your body rather than a manufactured weapon.

fields.name: Versatile
fields.description: Can be used to deal a different type of damage than the type listed in the damage entry.

fields.name: Volley
fields.description: This ranged weapon is less effective at close distances.
